abstracts.cdata!:
The Jiangxi Integrated Agricultural
            Modernization Project has three main components: Irrigation
            and Drainage; Farm Production Improvement; and Market
            Systems Development.. During construction, a certain amount
            of vegetation could be permanently disturbed due to dam
            reinforcement, canal schemes, and road upgrading. Animals
            that used to live in quietness will be disturbed by the
            noise. During project plan and design, natural reserves and
            wildlife habitat should be avoided. Earth borrowing, stone
            excavation, and waste disposal sites should be located far
            from those areas as well. Construction machineries should be
            kept far from those areas too. A comprehensive plan for
            earth and stone borrowing and dumping should be prepared to
            keep a balance between filling and excavations to reduce
            waste materials. To mitigate soil erosion, the area and
            number of construction sites should be reduced. Lime-clay
            mixing may cause dust and so mixing plants should be set up
            far enough from residences, hospitals, and schools. During
            operation, there is a potential agricultural non-point
            source pollution as a result of applying agrochemicals,
            pesticides, and animal manures. Corresponding mitigating
            measures include improving efficiency of agro-chemical
            application and control of pesticide use. A program of
            Schistosomiasis control and health improvement should be
            developed in the irrigation districts of Pengze and Yongxiu
            counties in which the low-lying areas are inhabited by snails.
